description: The host of “The O’Reilly Factor” recounts the final years of World War II.
title: KILLING THE RISING SUN
author: Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard

description: A Yale Law School graduate looks at the struggles of America’s white working class through his own childhood in the Rust Belt.
title: HILLBILLY ELEGY
author: J.D. Vance

description: The anchor of Fox News’s “The Kelly File” discusses why she left a succesful career as a lawyer, the value of hard work, the personal and professional challenges she has faced.
title: SETTLE FOR MORE
author: Megyn Kelly

description: How the accelerating pace of technology, globalization and climate change are reshaping the world, and what we can do about it.
title: THANK YOU FOR BEING LATE
author: Thomas L Friedman

description: An eyewitness account of Pearl Harbor by a 94-year-old veteran.
title: ALL THE GALLANT MEN
author: Donald Stratton with Ken Gire

description: The Vermont senator and former candidate for the Democratic nomination for president delivers his message of social and economic justice.
title: OUR REVOLUTION
author: Bernie Sanders

description: A meditation on race in America as well as a personal  story by the national correspondent of The Atlantic, framed as a letter to his teenage son.
title: BETWEEN THE WORLD AND ME
author: Ta-Nehisi Coates

description: The role of the white poor in American history.
title: WHITE TRASH
author: Nancy Isenberg

description: A law professor takes aim at the “war on drugs” and its impact on black men. Originally published in 2010.
title: THE NEW JIM CROW
author: Michelle Alexander

description: A law professor and MacArthur grant recipient’s memoir of his decades  of work to free innocent people condemned to death.
title: JUST MERCY
author: Bryan Stevenson
